reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 205/99: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY - MUNICIPALITY OF WEST NIPISSING
reg_info.reg_name_text: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY — MUNICIPALITY OF WEST NIPISSING
reg_info.citation: O. Reg. 205/99: DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY - MUNICIPALITY OF WEST NIPISSING
reg_info.act_under: Planning Act   Loi sur l’aménagement du territoire

content.content: 1. (1) The authority of the Minister under the following provisions is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to all applications made on or after March 31, 1999 for land in that municipality:  1. Subsection 50 (18) of the Act, to give approvals. 2. Section 51 of the Act, to approve a plan of subdivision. 3. Sections 50 and 53 of the Act, to give consents. 4. Section 57 of the Act, to issue a certificate of validation. 5. Section 50 of the Condominium Act, to approve or exempt condominium descriptions. 6. Subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act. 7. Subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act. 8. Section 146 of the Land Titles Act. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 1 (1). (2) The authority of the Minister under subsection 297 (10) of the Municipal Act is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to all by-laws passed on or after March 31, 1999 in that municipality. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 1 (2).
content.raw_html:
1. (1) The authority of the Minister under the following provisions is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to all applications made on or after March 31, 1999 for land in that municipality:

1. Subsection 50 (18) of the Act, to give approvals.

2. Section 51 of the Act, to approve a plan of subdivision.

3. Sections 50 and 53 of the Act, to give consents.

4. Section 57 of the Act, to issue a certificate of validation.

5. Section 50 of the Condominium Act, to approve or exempt condominium descriptions.

6. Subsection 305 (2) of the Municipal Act.

7. Subsection 88 (3) of the Registry Act.

8. Section 146 of the Land Titles Act. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 1 (1).

(2) The authority of the Minister under subsection 297 (10) of the Municipal Act is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to all by-laws passed on or after March 31, 1999 in that municipality. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 1 (2).

content.content: 2. (1) Despite section 1, all authority of the Minister under sections 50 and 53 of the Act to give consents is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to applications made before March 31, 1999 whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 2 (1). (2) Despite section 1, all authority of the Minister under section 51 of the Act to approve a plan of subdivision is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to applications made before March 31, 1999 whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 2. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 2 (2).
content.raw_html:
2. (1) Despite section 1, all authority of the Minister under sections 50 and 53 of the Act to give consents is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to applications made before March 31, 1999 whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 1. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 2 (1).

(2) Despite section 1, all authority of the Minister under section 51 of the Act to approve a plan of subdivision is delegated to the council of The Corporation of the Municipality of West Nipissing with respect to applications made before March 31, 1999 whose file numbers are set out in Schedule 2. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 2 (2).

content.content: 3. (1) If any authority delegated under section 1 or 2 is further delegated to a committee of the council or to an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 3 (1). (2) The delegation of authority under this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that the condition set out in subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 3 (2).
content.raw_html:
3. (1) If any authority delegated under section 1 or 2 is further delegated to a committee of the council or to an appointed officer under subsection 5 (1) of the Act, the council shall forward to the Minister a certified copy of the delegating by-law within 15 days of its passing. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 3 (1).

(2) The delegation of authority under this Regulation is not terminated by reason only that the condition set out in subsection (1) is not complied with. O. Reg. 205/99, s. 3 (2).

content.content: 4. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation). O. Reg. 205/99, s. 4.
